greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The a(n)-th composition in standard order (graded reverse-lexicographic) is the reversed unsorted prime signature of n.
comment: Unsorted prime signature (A124010) is the sequence of exponents in a number's prime factorization.

The k-th composition in standard order (row k of A066099) is obtained by taking the set of positions of 1's in the reversed binary expansion of k, prepending 0, taking first differences, and reversing again. This gives a bijective correspondence between nonnegative integers and integer compositions.
example: The unsorted prime signature of 12345678 is (1,2,1,1), whose reverse (1,1,2,1) is the 29th composition in standard order, so a(12345678) = 29.
xref: Positions of first appearances are A334031.
Least number with reversed prime signature is A331580.
All of the following pertain to compositions in standard order (A066099):
